variable.name: T2DG_ID
variable.description: Study ID of family member (4- letter code("T2DG") followed by 7-digit numeric ID number)

variable.name: ped
variable.description: Family ID ("pedigree number"): integer with a range from 2 to 47
variable.comment: Five individuals were sequenced who do not connect with any of the 20 large pedigrees. These have been assigned arbitrary pedigree identifiers 95 - 99.

variable.name: study
variable.description: Mnemonic of study of origin
variable.value: Combined San Antonio Family Diabetes and Gallbladder Studies

variable.name: sex
variable.description: Sex (1=male; 2=female)

variable.name: t2d
variable.description: Diabetes disease status (1=T2D; 0=not T2D) at the most recent study visit for which we have data for this participant
variable.comment: Once a diagnosis of diabetes is made that individual is considered diabetic at all later time points. One individual (T2DG1101387) has legitimately missing diabetes status. This individual is young and was seen only once and has no blood glucose or insulin measurements.

variable.name: T2D_1
variable.description: Diabetes disease status (1=T2D; 0=not T2D) at the first study visit

variable.name: T2D_2
variable.description: Diabetes disease status (1=T2D; 0=not T2D) at the second study visit

variable.name: T2D_3
variable.description: Diabetes disease status (1=T2D; 0=not T2D) at the third study visit

variable.name: T2D_4
variable.description: Diabetes disease status (1=T2D; 0=not T2D) at the fourth study visit

variable.name: T2D_5
variable.description: Diabetes disease status (1=T2D; 0=not T2D) at the fifth study visit

variable.name: T2D_NUM
variable.description: Number of study visits for which we have Diabetes disease status

variable.name: T2D_AGE
variable.description: Age of the participant at the most recent study visit for which we have Diabetes disease status

variable.name: T2D_YR
variable.description: Year of the most recent study visit for which we have Diabetes disease status

variable.name: aod
variable.description: Diabetes age at diagnosis (if affected) at the most recent study visit for which we have data for this participant

variable.name: AOD_1
variable.description: Diabetes age at diagnosis (if affected) at the first study visit

variable.name: AOD_2
variable.description: Diabetes age at diagnosis (if affected) at the second study visit

variable.name: AOD_3
variable.description: Diabetes age at diagnosis (if affected) at the third study visit

variable.name: AOD_4
variable.description: Diabetes age at diagnosis (if affected) at the fourth study visit

variable.name: AOD_5
variable.description: Diabetes age at diagnosis (if affected) at the fifth study visit

variable.name: AOD_YR
variable.description: Year of the most recent study visit for which we have Diabetes age at diagnosis (if affected)

variable.name: age
variable.description: Age of this participant at the most recent study visit for which we have data for this participant

variable.name: AGE_1
variable.description: Age of this participant at the first study visit

variable.name: AGE_2
variable.description: Age of this participant at the second study visit

variable.name: AGE_3
variable.description: Age of this participant at the third study visit

variable.name: AGE_4
variable.description: Age of this participant at the fourth study visit
variable.comment: Four individuals: T2DG1600768 T2DG1600810 T2DG1600816 T2DG1700865 show dates and ages at visit 4 which are later than their dates and ages at visit 5. This is correct and it avoids mixing up data collected for the same participants under different research projects (GOBS and FGS2).

variable.name: AGE_5
variable.description: Age of this participant at the fifth study visit
variable.comment: Four individuals: T2DG1600768 T2DG1600810 T2DG1600816 T2DG1700865 show dates and ages at visit 4 which are later than their dates and ages at visit 5. This is correct and it avoids mixing up data collected for the same participants under different research projects (GOBS and FGS2).

variable.name: AGE_NUM
variable.description: Number of study visits for which we have Age of this participant

variable.name: AGE_YR
variable.description: Year of the most recent study visit for which we have Age of this participant

variable.name: examyr
variable.description: Year when data were collected at the most recent study visit for which we have data for this participant

variable.name: EXAMYR_1

variable.name: EXAMYR_5

variable.comment: Four individuals: T2DG1600768 T2DG1600810 T2DG1600816 T2DG1700865 show dates and ages at visit 4 which are later than their dates and ages at visit 5. This is correct and it avoids mixing up data collected for the same participants under different research projects (GOBS and FGS2).

variable.name: ldl
variable.description: Calculated LDL cholesterol at the most recent study visit for which we have data for this participant
variable.comment: LDL cholesterol is calculated using the Friedewald equation: LDL = CHOL - (HDL + 0.45 * min(4.52; TG)) all in units of mmol/L. This calculation can be done only when all three components are measured at the same time point. Do not mix components measured at different time points. As is traditional LDL is shown as missing when the triglyceride concentration exceeds 4.52 mmol/L. However this creates informative missingness. A careful analysis will treat this situation separately as a diagnosis of type IV hyperlipoproteinemia. See Friedewald Levy and Fredrickson (1972) for details.

variable.name: LDL_1
variable.description: Calculated LDL cholesterol at the first study visit
variable.comment: LDL cholesterol is calculated using the Friedewald equation: LDL = CHOL - (HDL + 0.45 * min(4.52; TG)) all in units of mmol/L. This calculation can be done only when all three components are measured at the same time point. Do not mix components measured at different time points. As is traditional LDL is shown as missing when the triglyceride concentration exceeds 4.52 mmol/L. However this creates informative missingness. A careful analysis will treat this situation separately as a diagnosis of type IV hyperlipoproteinemia. See Friedewald Levy and Fredrickson (1972) for details.

variable.comment: LDL cholesterol is calculated using the Friedewald equation: LDL = CHOL - (HDL + 0.45 * min(4.52; TG)) all in units of mmol/L. This calculation can be done only when all three components are measured at the same time point. Do not mix components measured at different time points. As is traditional LDL is shown as missing when the triglyceride concentration exceeds 4.52 mmol/L. However this creates informative missingness. A careful analysis will treat this situation separately as a diagnosis of type IV hyperlipoproteinemia. See Friedewald Levy and Fredrickson (1972) for details.

variable.description: Year of the most recent study visit for which we have Lipid medication

variable.name: hormones
variable.description: Current use of female hormones? (1=yes; 0=no) at the most recent study visit for which we have data for this participant

variable.name: HORMONES_1
variable.description: Current use of female hormones? (1=yes; 0=no) at the first study visit

variable.name: HORMONES_2
variable.description: Current use of female hormones? (1=yes; 0=no) at the second study visit

variable.name: HORMONES_3
variable.description: Current use of female hormones? (1=yes; 0=no) at the third study visit

variable.name: HORMONES_4
variable.description: Current use of female hormones? (1=yes; 0=no) at the fourth study visit

variable.name: HORMONES_5
variable.description: Current use of female hormones? (1=yes; 0=no) at the fifth study visit
variable.comment: Please note: visit exam 5 includes only birth control pills; no data for other female hormones was directly recorded.

variable.name: HORMONES_EVER
variable.description: Current use of female hormones? (1=yes; 0=no) reported at any study visit
variable.comment: For medication data only: whether this participant ever reported currently taking this medication at the time of a study exam

variable.name: HORMONES_NUM
variable.description: Number of study visits for which we have Current use of female hormones

variable.description: Age of the participant at the most recent study visit for which we have Current use of female hormones

variable.name: HORMONES_YR
variable.description: Year of the most recent study visit for which we have Current use of female hormones

variable.name: cystatin_c
variable.description: Cystatin C concentration at the most recent study visit for which we have data for this participant
variable.comment: Cystatin C is measured using an ELISA assay kit from ALPCO Diagnostics. '<' indicates a data value below the assay detection threshold.

variable.description: Cystatin C concentration at the first study visit
variable.comment: '<' indicates a data value below the assay detection threshold.

variable.name: CYSTATIN_C_YR

variable.name: gad
variable.description: GAD Ab concentration at the most recent study visit for which we have data for this participant
variable.comment: GAD (glutamic acid decarboxylase) antibody is measured using an ELISA assay kit from KRONUS. '<' or '>' indicate data values below or above the assay detection or saturation thresholds

variable.name: adiponectin
variable.description: Adiponectin concentration at the most recent study visit for which we have data for this participant
variable.comment: Adiponectin measurements show an unexplained two-fold difference between FHS at visit 1 and FDGS at visit 3. FHS at visit 3 seems to bridge between the two.

variable.description: Adiponectin concentration at the first study visit
